entry.title: Fluorspar to fluorochemicals upon low-temperature activation in water
entry.content:
Fluorspar to fluorochemicals upon low-temperature activation in water

Fluorochemicals are obtained directly from fluorspar activated in water at low temperature, without the requirement to manufacture hydrogen fluoride, a toxic and hazardous gas that is central to the current industrial process.

  • Immo Klose
  • Calum Patel
  • VÃ©ronique Gouverneur
ArticleOpen Access13 Nov 2024

entry.title: Task-agnostic exoskeleton control via biological joint moment estimation
entry.content:
Task-agnostic exoskeleton control via biological joint moment estimation

A task-agnostic controller assists the user on the basis of instantaneous estimates of lower-limb biological joint moments from a deep neural network so exoskeletons can aid users across a broad spectrum of human activities.

  • Dean D. Molinaro
  • Keaton L. Scherpereel
  • Aaron J. Young
Article13 Nov 2024

entry.title: Mapping the ionosphere with millions of phones
entry.content:
Mapping the ionosphere with millions of phones

Data from millions of smartphones are used to map the ionosphere in greater detail, leading to improved smartphone location accuracy, particularly in parts of the world with few monitoring stations.

  • Jamie Smith
  • Anton Kast
  • Brian P. Williams
ArticleOpen Access13 Nov 2024

entry.title: Accelerated formation of ultra-massive galaxies in the first billion years
entry.content:
Accelerated formation of ultra-massive galaxies in the first billion years 

A study of 36 massive galaxies at redshifts between 5 and 9 from the JWST FRESCO survey finds that galaxy formation of the most massive galaxies is 2â3 times higher than the most efficient galaxies at later epochs.

  • Mengyuan Xiao
  • Pascal A. Oesch
  • J. Stuart B. Wyithe
Article13 Nov 2024

entry.title: High-temperature 205Tl decay clarifies 205Pb dating in early Solar System
entry.content:
High-temperature 205Tl decay clarifies 205Pb dating in early Solar System

Measurement of the bound-state Î²â decay of 205Tl81+ gives a new, longer half-life, allowing for the calculation of accurate stellar 205Pb yields and the isolation time of the early Solar System.

  • Guy Leckenby
  • Ragandeep Singh Sidhu
  • Jianwei Zhao
ArticleOpen Access13 Nov 2024

entry.title: Evolving antibody response to SARS-CoV-2 antigenic shift from XBB to JN.1
entry.content:
Evolving antibody response to SARS-CoV-2 antigenic shift from XBB to JN.1

  • Fanchong Jian
  • Jing Wang
  • Yunlong Cao
Article07 Nov 2024

entry.title: Coordinated inheritance of extrachromosomal DNAs in cancer cells
entry.content:
Coordinated inheritance of extrachromosomal DNAs in cancer cells

Cooperative species of extrachromosomal DNAs are coordinately inherited through mitotic co-segregation.

  • King L. Hung
  • Matthew G. Jones
  • Howard Y. Chang
ArticleOpen Access06 Nov 2024

entry.title: Selective ion transport through hydrated micropores in polymer membranes
entry.content:
Selective ion transport through hydrated micropores in polymer membranes

A method for design of polymer membranes uses strategically placed pendant groups with specific hydrophobicity to precisely tailor hydrated pore size, with applications in ion-conducting membranes for redox flow batteries.

  • Anqi Wang
  • Charlotte Breakwell
  • Qilei Song
ArticleOpen Access06 Nov 2024

entry.title: Autonomous mobile robots for exploratory synthetic chemistry
entry.content:
Autonomous mobile robots for exploratory synthetic chemistry

A modular autonomous platform for general exploratory synthetic chemistry uses mobile robots to integrate an automated synthesis platform and two analysis platforms.

  • Tianwei Dai
  • Sriram Vijayakrishnan
  • Andrew I. Cooper
ArticleOpen Access06 Nov 2024

entry.title: Preferential occurrence of fast radio bursts in massive star-forming galaxies
entry.content:
Preferential occurrence of fast radio bursts in massive star-forming galaxies

Analysis of the stellar population properties of 30 host galaxies of fast radio bursts (FRBs) suggests an abundance of FRBs in massive star-forming galaxies, and implies that the formation of FRB sourcesâmagnetarsâis linked to core-collapse supernovae of stellar merger remnants.

  • Kritti Sharma
  • Vikram Ravi
  • Yuhan Yao
Article06 Nov 2024

entry.title: A cellular basis for mapping behavioural structure
entry.content:
A cellular basis for mapping behavioural structure

Mice generalize complex task structures by using neurons in the medial frontal cortex that encode progress to task goals and embed behavioural sequences.

  • Mohamady El-Gaby
  • Adam Loyd Harris
  • Timothy E. J. Behrens
ArticleOpen Access06 Nov 2024

entry.title: Immune responses in checkpoint myocarditis across heart, blood and tumour
entry.content:
Immune responses in checkpoint myocarditis across heart, blood and tumour

The molecular characteristics of myocarditis associated with immune checkpoint inhibitors are described and potential biomarkers of onset and severity are identified.

  • Steven M. Blum
  • Daniel A. Zlotoff
  • Alexandra-ChloÃ© Villani
Article06 Nov 2024

entry.title: Identification and genetic dissection of convergent persister cell states
entry.content:
Identification and genetic dissection of convergent persister cell states

Single-cell transcriptome analyses of growth phases in Escherichia coli identify a distinct transcriptional state occupied by antibiotic-tolerant persisters in which lon and yqgE have major roles.

  • Sydney B. Blattman
  • Wenyan Jiang
  • Saeed Tavazoie
ArticleOpen Access06 Nov 2024

entry.title: Nucleosome flipping drives kinetic proofreading and processivity by SWR1
entry.content:
Nucleosome flipping drives kinetic proofreading and processivity by SWR1

Nucleosome flipping mediates a proofreading and processive mechanism of histone exchange driven by the chromatin remodeller SWR1.

  • Paul Girvan
  • Adam S. B. Jalal
  • David S. Rueda
ArticleOpen Access06 Nov 2024

entry.title: Mutant-selective AKT inhibition through lysine targeting and neo-zinc chelation
entry.content:
Mutant-selective AKT inhibition through lysine targeting and neo-zinc chelation

A mutant-selective AKT inhibitor shows potential as a targeted therapy for breast cancer, enabling enhanced target engagement and avoiding the dose-limiting toxicity associated with pan-AKT inhibitors.

  • Gregory B. Craven
  • Hang Chu
  • Jack Taunton
Article06 Nov 2024

entry.title: Stochastic neuropeptide signals compete to calibrate the rate of satiation
entry.content:
Stochastic neuropeptide signals compete to calibrate the rate of satiation

Release of hunger-promoting and satiety-promoting neuropeptides drives opposing changes in the second messenger cAMP in awake mouse paraventricular hypothalamic MC4R neurons, thereby regulating synaptic plasticity and the transition to satiety with each bite of food.

  • Stephen X. Zhang
  • Angela Kim
  • Mark L. Andermann
Article06 Nov 2024

entry.title: A mechanism for hypoxia-induced inflammatory cell death in cancer
entry.content:
A mechanism for hypoxia-induced inflammatory cell death in cancer

We find that PTP1B and ABL1/2 reciprocally control RNF213 tyrosine phosphorylation and its oligomerization and RZ domain activation, and identify a unique PTP1BâRNF213âCYLDâSPATA2 pathway critical for the control of inflammatory cell death in hypoxic tumours.

  • Abhishek Bhardwaj
  • Maria C. Panepinto
  • Benjamin G. Neel
Article06 Nov 2024

entry.title: A multicellular developmental program in a close animal relative
entry.content:
A multicellular developmental program in a close animal relative

The ichthyosporean Chromosphaera perkinsii develops via symmetry breaking and cleavage divisions, and it forms spatially organized colonies with distinct cell types.

  • Marine Olivetta
  • Chandni Bhickta
  • Omaya Dudin
Article06 Nov 2024

entry.title: Central pattern generator control of a vertebrate ultradian sleep rhythm
entry.content:
Central pattern generator control of a vertebrate ultradian sleep rhythm

Central pattern generators of a type usually known to control motor rhythms may also organize vertebrate ultradian sleep rhythm.

  • Lorenz A. Fenk
  • Juan Luis Riquelme
  • Gilles Laurent
ArticleOpen Access06 Nov 2024

entry.title: Automated real-world data integration improves cancer outcome prediction
entry.content:
Automated real-world data integration improves cancer outcome prediction

A study generates a clinicogenomics dataset resource, MSK-CHORD, that combines natural language processing-derived clinical annotations with patient medical data from various sources to improve models of cancer outcome.

  • Justin Jee
  • Christopher Fong
  • Xinran Bi
ArticleOpen Access06 Nov 2024
